In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is how you can write the function in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(s::String, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(s, " ") # Split string into individual words
    lines = String[]  # To store the lines of text
    current_line = ""   # To store current line of text
    
    for word in words
        if length(current_line*word) > text_width 
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = ""
        end
        current_line *= word*" "
    end
    
    # add the remaining text (if any) to lines
    push!(lines, current_line)
    
    return join(lines, "\n")
end
```
This function splits the input string into words and then iterates over each word. If the length of the current line combined with the word exceeds `text_width`, it adds the current line to the array of lines and starts a new line. The remaining words (if any) are added at the end.

Here is an example of how you can use this function:

```julia
println(wrap_string("Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua"))
```
This will produce the following output:

```
Lorem ipsum dolor 
sit amet, 
consectetur adipiscing 
elit, 
sed do eiusmod tempor 
incididunt ut labore et 
dolore magna aliqua
```
